mercurialtools.landing_patchouli_text: Thanks for trying Mercurial Tools! This is a short guide to help explain the functions of the mod items and blocks.
mercurialtools.category_blocks_descripti: Mainly blocks intended for creating farms, reducing grinding and compressing more elaborate mechanisms.
block.mercurialtools.condensing_hopper_d: A hopper that compresses items as it pushes them to their destination.
block.mercurialtools.ender_keystone_desc: A keystone from the End, embossed with spatial distortion reagents. When you pass over it, you skip up to 32 blocks.$(br2)Can be tricky to use: $(li)Sprint across it to blink laterally in the direction you're mostly running. $(li)Jump while standing on it to blink upward. $(li)Sneak while standing on it to blink downward.

If you jump off of it, it will grant you temporary slow falling proportionate to the power of the blink. In theory, you should only ever blink to a safe location. Unsafe warps that would disperse your molecules into solid matter should instead do nothing.
block.mercurialtools.ender_keystone_damp: You can dampen an Ender Keystone with carpet to reduce its effects by half, up to 3 times. Using a piece of flint on any dampened keystone reverts it to a normal Keystone.
block.mercurialtools.ender_vacuum_descri: A shulker box, imbued with greed. Pulls items from a moderate distance.
Items will even pass through walls.
block.mercurialtools.enticing_prism_desc: A sea lantern enhanced to make fishing bobbers more attractive. Bobbers tick +100% as fast.
Stackable (additively), but take care not to make it too fast!
block.mercurialtools.expanding_hopper_de: A hopper that decompress items as it pushes them to their destination.
block.mercurialtools.frugal_anvil_descri: In spite of the wealth this anvil required, the investment is worth it. Repairs and enchantments on this anvil have their costs reduced to a third of the experience levels they would have been
Perhaps just as importantly, the anvil cannot be damaged or destroyed.
block.mercurialtools.growth_pulser_descr: A sea lantern enhanced to radiate growth to a 9x9x9 area. Guarantees a growth tick every ten seconds.
block.mercurialtools.interloper_descript: An observer made angry by dark magic. Unpowered, reduces living entities to 1 health. Powered, kills them outright.
The 9x9x5 death field is projected forward, centered on the block face
block.mercurialtools.mercurial_grindston: A grindstone enhanced with high-quality materials and magic binding properties. With this grindstone, you can perform two key functions: $(br2)$(li)Firstly, any enchanted item can have its enchantments sequentially stripped away with books.$(li)Secondly, any repairable item can have its repair cost reduced substantially by spending Mercurial Blend.
There is no limit to the number of times repair costs can be lowered. Keep your favorite items... favorite. Books and Mercurial Blend go in the bottom slot, target item on top!
block.mercurialtools.spawner_template_de: A lifeless spawner, awaiting a soul to materialize eternally.
Right click with a filled Soul Tome to create a spawner.
mercurialtools.category_items_descriptio: Mostly inventory utilities, but a couple of things that are special.
item.mercurialtools.crystal_compass_desc: A compass that only shows the way to crystals. What a piece of junk.
Shows lapis, emerald, diamond, nether quartz and glowstone.
item.mercurialtools.cubing_talisman_desc: A talisman that turns things that can be cubed... into cubes. Tries to keep as many single items as will fit in a stack, but cubes the rest.
Deactivate by right-clicking (turns red). Stops cubing.
item.mercurialtools.enchanting_star_desc: A crystalline star, wrested from a powerful foe. Its latent enchantment seems to endlessly imbue you with wisdom. As your experience grows, the experience it grants gets a bit slower.
Starting at 1 exp every 4 seconds, the delay increases by 5% each level, additively.
item.mercurialtools.ethereal_mallet_desc: A phantasmal mallet that seems to ripple the fabric of reality with the faintest movement. Opens a cosmic pocket dimension when used, allowing you to store things in the space at will and retrieve them later. Obviously cannot be placed inside of its own pocket...
Items in the space which "tick" will tick as though in your inventory.
item.mercurialtools.internal_clock_descr: A fleshy clock that seems to mirror the internal state of the holder. This shows you how long it has been since you last rested. "Using" the clock seems to increase your fatigue.
When the clock points to the moon, phantoms may spawn. Progressing one's internal clock, it should be noted, can create quite an appetite.
item.mercurialtools.mending_ember_descri: This ember seems to resonate with items enchanted with Mending. Instead of repairing when experience is collected, it will actively maintain items from your experience pool instead. The experience-to-durability ratio is effectively the same as it would be via collection.
Deactivate by right-clicking (turns to ash) to cease the active draining of experience for repairs.
item.mercurialtools.mercurial_blend_desc: Useless on its own, but used to make other things.
Ugh, and it takes slime balls.
item.mercurialtools.mercurial_manual_des: It's so meta, even this acronym.
item.mercurialtools.moderating_geode_des: A geode that aborbs minerals, leaving a moderate amount on hand.
Deactivate by right-clicking (turns dull). Dumps inventory.
item.mercurialtools.potion_belt_descript: A potion belt for stashing excessive potions and empty bottles. Leaves you one of each potion it holds.
Deactivate by right-clicking (pouches detach). Dumps inventory.
item.mercurialtools.quiver_description: A quiver for stashing excessive arrows. Leaves you one stack of each kind it holds.
item.mercurialtools.quiver_description_e: Deactivate by right-clicking (quiver upended). Dumps inventory.
item.mercurialtools.soul_tome_descriptio: A mercurial grimoire with the magic to capture a soul.
Holding the tome, strike a creature when it is near death.
